page.title: 01 Introduction to the Area
page.content: The area covered is in East Northamptonshire. It is to the north east of Kettering and the North West of Thrapston. It is very gently undulating at around 100 metres above sea level. It consists of open farmland and much of the farmland is covered with crops, the main one being wheat. There are some areas of woodland around the 12 km square area. The main area of woodland is Grafton Park Wood in the north. The two places of habitation are the villages of Grafton Underwood in the south west and the smaller village of Slipton in the south east. Both are very quiet stone built villages. The area is crossed from north to south and from east to west by quiet country roads.
